p: The detailed procedure of obtaining S. montana extracts via spray drying is described by Vidović et al. [ 33]. Spray-dried extract (SD) is produced by drying liquid extracts via spray drying (inlet temperature 120 °C, outlet temperature 80 °C). S. montana liquid extracts were obtained using a 50% ethanol mixture as an extraction solvent. The extraction was carried out for five days at room temperature in a dark place. Maltodextrin (DE16) in the percentage of 10% (calculated on extract dry weight) was used as a carrier material [ 33].
